Armenian prime minister and church leader clash over opposing visions for country's future
subhead: Nikol Pashinyan, the head of government, angered the highest dignitary of the Armenian Apostolic Church, Karekin II, by focusing on 'real Armenia' within its current, internationally recognized borders. The two men are at odds with each other and have each called for the other's resignation.

EU chief and Trump strike trade deal in transatlantic standoff
subhead: The US president told reporters the deal involved a baseline levy of 15% on EU exports to the US. The agreement came as the clock ticked down on an August 1 deadline for the EU to strike a deal with Washington, or face an across-the-board US levy of 30%.

title: Léon Marchand rides post-Olympic wave into World Championships in Singapore

title: Earning a good living, yet feeling poor: How social media creates financial dysmorphia
subhead: Money flaunts itself on social media, exposing Gen Z's obsession with wealth as the ultimate goal. Luxury hotels, lavish vacations, expensive clothes: These images warp our relationship with reality, leading some to develop a distorted perception of their financial situation.

title: Retracing James Baldwin's footsteps in Istanbul, the city that saved his life
subhead: The American author and playwright first set foot in Istanbul in 1961, at the age of 36. Turkey was then alive with an artistic and intellectual effervescence, and for 10 years it became his refuge – a place of celebration and intense literary creation.
